main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in the sky over New Plymouth, New Zealand on May 18, 1963.
interesting points: The object was observed to be stationary, but also capable of sudden high speeds and flashing, changing brightness.
The object was described as white and blue in color, extremely bright, and somewhat blurred or fuzzy in appearance.
The object was observed between the observer's location and the moon, and disappeared towards the south.
The observation lasted for approximately 4 minutes.
The object was reported to have caused slight bursts of radio/electrical interference.
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
